pull_requests.title: BIP380: make specs consistent about hardened indicators
pull_requests.body:
Me and my students noticed a discrepancy in the test vectors and specification regarding the allowed characters denoting hardened nodes. The [BIP380](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0380.mediawiki) specs allows all three `h`, `'` and `H`, in particular the specs read:

> In the above specification, the hardened indicator `h` may be replaced with alternative 
hardened indicators of `H` or `'`.

However, the following is then an **invalid** test vectors:

> [deadbeef/0H/0H/0H]0260b2003c386519fc9eadf2b5cf124dd8eea4c4e68d5e154050a9346ea98ce600

Thus, I've added new test vectors allowing `H` and removed the inconsistent one. 

However, I am far from claiming that this is the **correct** way how to handle this. I've checked that [people](https://github.com/search?q=%2F%28%3F-i%290H%5C%2F0H%5C%2F%2F&type=code) are using the `H`, but I got no (meaningful or relevant) hits when searching for the exact test vector. I didn't see the option to create issues, thus I've continued by proposing the, what _seems_ to be, reasonable changes.

pull_requests.title: BIP380: minor grammar fixups
pull_requests.body: Adding a few minor changes after having read the specs a couple of times.

comment_list.body: Thanks for merging. Bringing value was indeed the intention, as you can see also in https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1803. Prior to creating the PR I've checked the [Contribution guidelines](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md), but that didn't answer the question, whether such a PR would be appreciated. Since asking in an issue is not an option, I just created the PR and let the maintainers decide. There is a [list](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aclosed+typo) of sometimes single character typo fix PRs, I believe(d) this one fits in.

pull_requests.title: bip-0119/simulation.py minor correction
pull_requests.body:
Hey , found some minor errors in `simulation.py`
COMPRESSABLE -> COMPRESSIBLE 3x

comment_list.body: Compressable seems to be an alternative form of compressible. It appears to be rarely used but not incorrect.
Thank you for your contribution. As this patch touches code, it would require BIP author review and sign-off and I'm not sure this change is worth asking for their limited time. Closing for now.
